page.title: 04Landscape of Itchenor area
page.content: The land is very flat, only rising to 13 ft. above sea level on Thorney which is hedged fields of crops and grassland with a few stunted trees, the mile wide promontory being surrounded on three sides by areas of marshland at low tide. The end of the runway of the old airfield lies in the N. There are no buildings. The mainland rises to 23ft. in S. and is mainly agricultural, the greater part being farmed by Itchenor Park. There is a "rife" or very small stream that flows past the church and there are pockets of woodland, the largest near Chalkdock Point and Itchenor House but there many tall field hedges. The areas of housing are at Itchenor, Rookwood, Malthouse Cottages, Redlands and Chapel Lanes, and along the main road.
